intro: Melampyrum velebiticum, commonly known as the Velebit touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
